disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Tuesday 7 June to end of Wednesday 8 June GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Warm sunny spells and a few well scattered showers.<br/><br/>Currently back trajectories are indicating that the air will be mainly from the west so should be relatively 'clean' with little pollution import.<br/><br/>With adequate dispersion of local emissions, air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Thursday 9 June to end of Thursday 9 June GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Sunny early on with cloud developing.<br/><br/>An ongoing Atlantic westerly airflow should ensure relatively 'clean' air and good dispersion of any local emissions.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/>
